Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 29 points and Kristaps Porzingis added 25 points as the Boston Celtics held off the Denver Nuggets 118-106.
Nikola Jokic, the three-time NBA MVP, sat out due to illness.
Porzingis had 11 rebounds, while Jrue Holiday contributed 19 points.
Russell Westbrook had 26 points for Denver and eight turnovers.
Michael Porter Jr. added 15 points and 10 rebounds for the Nuggets.
Boston outscored Denver by a 60-46 margin in the paint.
The Celtics went on a 15-0 run to help cement the win.
There were 10 lead changes and eight ties during the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was set to feature two of the top players in the league, but Nikola Jokic was ruled out due to illness.
The Nuggets were also missing Aaron Gordon due to a calf injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Celtics: Stellar defense down the stretch, including steals from Al Horford and Jayson Tatum.
Nuggets: The bench had a solid showing with Julian Strawther scoring 19 and Peyton Watson 14.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A cup of ice spilled on the court with 8:56 remaining, causing a momentary break.
Key moment: Michael Porter Jr. appeared to be fouled by Sam Hauser going in for a dunk with 2:57 left in the third quarter, but the Celtics won the challenge.
